what: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
title: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
text: Created John Ewen 2011 paper; "Hydrograph matching method measuring model performance". Three visual parameters (b, maxLag maxLead) give user flexibility designing suitable performance measures.

title: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
code: HMA(   obs = NULL,   sim = NULL,   b = 4,   maxLag = 3,   maxLead = 3,   measure = "nse",   calcRays = TRUE )

title: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
text: obs Observed series sim Simulated series b Scaling factor timing errors, larger values degenerate NSE maxLag Also known w1, determines number time indices looked observed backwards maxLead Also known w2, determines number time indices looked observed forwards measure Determines objective calcRays Option calculate rays plotting. Set TRUE.

title: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
text: Model performance data

title: John Ewens Hydrograph Matching Algorithm — HMA
code: qo <- c(3, 3, 4, 20, 62, 85, 33, 20, 5) qs <- c(5, 12, 65, 43, 34, 28, 13, 12, 22)  a <- HMA(obs = qo, sim = qs, b = 4, maxLag = 1, maxLead = 3, measure = 'nse') plot(qo, type = 'l', col = 'blue', lwd = 2,      xlab = 'Timestep',           ylab = 'Flow')           lines(qs, col = 'orange', lwd = 2)           for (i in seq_along(a$Rays)){             segments(a$Rays[[i]]$obs[1], a$Rays[[i]]$obs[2], a$Rays[[i]]$sim[1], a$Rays[[i]]$sim[2], lty = 2)             }

title: peakDet — peakDet
text: peak detection algorithm R; finds local maxima minima. Based algorithm MATLAB Eli Billauer (http://www.billauer.co.il/peakdet.html). list containing two data frames maxtab mintab containing maxima minima. Data frames contain two columns indices v (corresponding values x provided) values v.

title: peakDet — peakDet
text: v numeric vector search peaks. delta numeric length one; defining local threshold peak detection. x numeric vector length v containing corresponding x-values v.

title: peakDet — peakDet
text: Peak detected points

title: peakDet — peakDet
code: x <- seq(0, 20, .05) vals <- sin(x) det <- peakDet(vals, .5, x) det #> $maxtab #>     pos       val #> 1  1.55 0.9997838 #> 2  7.85 0.9999921 #> 3 14.15 0.9999177 #>  #> $mintab #>    pos        val #> 1  4.7 -0.9999233 #> 2 11.0 -0.9999902 #> 3 17.3 -0.9997744 #>  plot(x = x, y = vals, frame = FALSE, xlab = 'Time', ylab = 'Stage', type = 'l'); points(det$maxtab$val~det$maxtab$pos, bg = 'red', pch = 21, col = 'black', lwd = 0.9, cex = 1.5); points(det$mintab$val~det$mintab$pos, bg = 'blue', pch = 21, col = 'black', lwd = 0.9, cex = 1.5)
